column3: you only cry once." The meaning of that expression is that if you spend at the front end
column4: that's the only time you'll wince. The Pit Room's one-meat platter - one meat
column6: and bread - runs $12.75. With a drink and tax
column7: you're looking at $16.51. But...you get a LOT of food for that money and you WILL be full. If you're not wanting to spend quite that much
column8: you can still experience their excellent brisket by ordering it a la carte (in increments of a quarter pound for $5 per unit)
column9: with individual sides running about $3.50. But unless you only want a quarter pound of meat
column10: you're not going to be able to beat that $12.75 deal - I've tried!
